etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Charles Shepard (1804–1886). From French nontronite from Nontron, the name of the town in Dordogne, France, where the mineral was first found + -ite

definitions: A pale yellow or greenish crystalline clay mineral, Na₀.₃₃ Fe₂ 3+(Si,Al)₄ O₁₀ (OH)₂, belonging to the smectite or montmorillonite group and sometimes resembling opal.
